definition: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
sleeve/to tuck inside one's sleeve
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: We must not stand by when people damage state property.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須與壞人壞事作鬥爭，不能袖手旁觀。

sentences.english: The protesters were throwing bottles at Japanese restaurants, as the police looked on laughing.
sentences.chinese: 抗議者們向日本餐館扔鞋，警方則袖手旁觀看笑話。

sentences.english: No man could stand aside in such a condition.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，不會有人袖手旁觀的。

sentences.english: What does 'T. G. ' stand for in 'T. G. Smith'?
sentences.chinese: 他那樣虐待他的狗，你怎能袖手旁觀呢？

sentences.english: But I can't just sit back and watch either. I'm pretty pissed at him too, you know.
sentences.chinese: 但我也不能袖手旁觀，我也看他不順眼，明白嗎？

sentences.english: I wouldn't sit aside when somebody's being harmed.
sentences.chinese: 我不會看着別人受到傷害而袖手旁觀。

sentences.english: The ships of the Athenians and their allies sulked unhelpfully.
sentences.chinese: 雅典人及其同盟軍的船隻袖手旁觀。

sentences.english: If good people stand by , evil will conquer all.
sentences.chinese: 如果好人袖手旁觀，邪惡勢力就會戰勝一切。

sentences.english: Three Little Stupas sitting by a tree.
sentences.chinese: 三小舍利塔袖手旁觀一棵樹。

sentences.english: Joe sat back in his seat, leaning hard on it.
sentences.chinese: 喬在他的座位中袖手旁觀，在它上努力地傾斜。

definition: to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to deceive/to conceal
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to be reluctant to give up a post
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to make way (for sth)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to censure
disproof/rebuttal/reductio ad absurdum
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
